job description:
Equipment Management Roles and Responsibilities:

Responsible for Engineering and Design of macro and small cell equipment in Northern California/NV. Projects include macros, small cells, and in-building solutions.
Forecast future cell site needs including but not limited to E/// equipment, cabinets, antennas, batteries, power plants, generators, and other major materials.
Manage the ordering and delivery of equipment for timely equipment arrival. The goal is to have equipment ready prior to construction start.
Look at reusing available inventory first prior to ordering new equipment.
Prepare purchase order requests and ensure vendor payment on receipts.
Keep current and updated with the latest Maintenance Engineering approved equipment.
Ensure optimum equipment allocation and efficiency.
Communicate information and follow-up to the internal Telecommunication team.
Support construction team and Network Assurance with equipment issues.
Perform risk management to process to minimize project risks. Identify risks in the program.

Requirements:

5+ years experience as a Project Manager in Wireless
5+ years experience in construction and utility coordination
Strong working knowledge of MS Office, Siterra, and SiteTraker
PMP certification is a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong project management and communication skills and ability to work with various departments
Candidate must have strong experience with E/// and cell site equipment
Solid technical background with understanding of 4G LTE infrastructure
Must be self-managed and motivated.
Experience in managing budgets and peoplesoft skills.
Knowledge of Data Analytics and visualization
